title: Ticket #6280: starter incorrectly sets JobStartDate to the current job start time
description:
G-RESEARCH was trying to calculate the time a job spent waiting in the queue before it first began to run, and was using the expression JobstartDate - QDate. This should work, since JobStartDate is documented to be the time the job first starts (set by the Schedd to the shadow birthdate when the job doesn't yet have a JobStartDate).

But the Starter is sending a value for JobStartDate with each update ad to the shadow, and it is setting the value to the time that it called create_process, and not paying any attention to the current value.

The result is that sometime after the job begins running, or when the job is placed on hold, the value of JobStartDate changes.

This is clearly wrong, but it is likely that there are users that have Startd policy expressions that depend on having JobStartDate be the start time of the current run.

So the fix for the stable series is to have the shadow filter JobStartDate out of the update ad before procesing it. This will result in the Schedd and the user seeing what it expects to see.

In the development version, we should also change the Starter to set JobCurrentStartDate or even some new attribute where is now tries to set JobStartDate
